title: Did You Know? The Origin of 'Debugging'
excerpt: A fun historical fact about programming terminology that might surprise you.
author: Codem
content:
The Story Behind 'Debugging'

Here's a fun fact that might surprise you about the origin of the term "debugging" in programming.

The Real Story

While many believe the term comes from when Grace Hopper found an actual moth in a computer, the truth is more nuanced.

The term "bug" was actually used in engineering contexts long before computers. Thomas Edison used it in his notebooks in the 1870s to describe technical glitches.

However, Grace Hopper did popularize the term in computing when she literally found a moth stuck in a relay of the Harvard Mark II computer in 1947. She taped the moth into the computer's logbook with the note "First actual case of bug being found."

So while the term existed before, Grace Hopper's incident definitely helped cement "debugging" in the computing lexicon!
